solidstack.cache
Class ReadThroughCache

java.lang.Object
  solidstack.cache.ReadThroughCache

public class ReadThroughCache
extends Object

A read-through cache. This cache does not care about memory, it only cares about time. Entries expire and are reloaded. Old entries will be purged periodically.

Since:
2012
Author:
René de Bloois

setExpirationMillis

public void setExpirationMillis(int expirationMillis)
Sets the number of milliseconds before a cache entry expires. On the next access the entry will be reloaded.

Parameters:
expirationMillis - the number of milliseconds before a cache entry expires.

Returns the grace period.

Returns:
The grace period.

setGracePeriodMillis

public void setGracePeriodMillis(int gracePeriodMillis)
Sets the grace period. The grace period only has effect for non blocking access or when the cache is in non blocking mode.

Parameters:
gracePeriodMillis - The grace period.

The wait timeout.

get

public <T> T get(ReadThroughCache.Loader<T> loader,
                 Object... key)
Get a value from the cache. If the value is not found or the value is expired, the loader is called to get a new value to store in the cache. During load, other threads that are trying to get the same value are blocked until loading is finished.

Parameters:
loader - The loader to load values.
key - The key into the cache.
Returns:
The value belonging to the key.

buildKey

public static String buildKey(Object... objects)
Transform an array of objects to a key.

Parameters:
objects - The array of objects.
Returns:
The resulting key.
